Businesses will run nodes if and only if they earn more money from it than it costs.

1125418192262844427.text: No one needs to store the entire blockchain for all time. As we scale up to terabyte and larger sized blocks, miners will store only the UTXO set. If there is value in doing so, businesses and other organizations will store some or all of the historical blockchain data.

2019 | Court | 100%

1125055801968689153.text: People often think it's important to run a full node at home because it allows you to validate your own transactions. But you don't need to run a full node for that. Full nodes are for validating everyone's transactions. Validating only your own requires vastly fewer resources.

1124925193569341440.text: If you like validating 7 transactions per second, you can continue to validate 7 tx/s at gigabyte, terabyte, and larger block sizes. How? Simple: Continue to validate 7 tx/s. If there are 107 tx/s, ignore 100 of them. If there are 1007 tx/s, ignore 1000 of them, etc.

1124876371409420289.text: Bitcoin Core has introduced radical changes to the protocol, particularly removing signatures from the transaction chains and capping the volume of transactions. Bitcoin SV is the only blockchain that still follows the Bitcoin whitepaper.

1124749534775644163.text: If you want to help Bitcoin, create a real business that earns money by producing value for people.

1124693416674254849.text: Bitcoin is powered by market economics. You do not need to sacrifice anything or do anything altruistic to help the network. It is 100% secured by people acting in their own self interest.

1124562803963174913.text:
Fascinating to see how off people were about why the double hash back in 2011. All of their guesses have to do with security. They were all wrong. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=45456.0 …

The real answer is the ability to prove possession without revealing the data.https://medium.com/@craig_10243/the-puzzle-of-the-double-hash-968196edb06d …

1124513985095786497.text: People like to analyze things with their brains, but eventually computers will be faster at everything. The Bitter Lesson. http://www.incompleteideas.net/IncIdeas/BitterLesson.html …

1124387145551097857.text: Privacy improves at scale. It gets much easier to use basic privacy techniques if blocks are very big because your transactions are that much harder to separate from the rest. Don't reuse addresses, and take advantage of DH, merge avoidance, coinjoin, etc.

1124331027789418497.text: Specialization is good for the economy. I make hats, you make shirts, and we trade. The Bitcoin economy will work the same way at scale. Storage, computation, and transfer will all be specialized. Do what you're good at. Earn Bitcoin. No one will do everything.

1124200415179038725.text: Not everyone is going to run a node. Businesses will run nodes when it makes economic sense for them to do so.

Every problem with Bitcoin can be solved with Bitcoin.

Examples:

- instant transactions: pay for it.
- smart contracts: pay for it.
- storage: pay for it.
- computation: pay for it.
- transfer: pay for it.

...pay for it...

...WITH BITCOIN.

1123299981849497600.text: Because you can unroll loops, you can create arbitrarily sophisticated scripts. But you don't necessarily need long scripts. Instead, you can have many small scripts in parallel or series to do complicated things. Every problem with Bitcoin can be solved with Bitcoin.
